SEARCH
Package com.ubicua.didas.rest

Class DidasClientDiscoveryProvider

java.lang.Object
com.ubicua.didas.rest.DidasClientDiscoveryProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.keycloak.provider.Provider, org.keycloak.services.resource.RealmResourceProvider
@Path("/realms") public class DidasClientDiscoveryProvider extends Object implements org.keycloak.services.resource.RealmResourceProvider
JAX-RS provider exposing the DID discovery document at /realms/{realm}/.well-known/did.json.

Fetches service discovery components and UI page providers to assemble a JSON array representing DID service entries.

Author:
Ivan Kuchumov

    • getServiceJson

      @NotNull private String getServiceJson(@NotNull org.keycloak.models.RoleModel role, String rootUrl)
      Builds a JSON representation of a DID service entry for a given client role.

      The resulting JSON follows the structure: 

       {
   "@context": [ array of context URIs ],
   "id":  the unique document ID,
   "service": [
     {
       "id": "…",
       "type": "…",
       "serviceEndpoint": "…"
     },
     …
   ]
 }

      Process

      1. Collect contexts Extract all values under DOCUMENT_CONTEXT and join them into a JSON array.
      2. Determine document ID Use the first (and only) value under DOCUMENT_ID as the DID document’s id.
      3. Build service entries
        1. For each raw DOCUMENT_SERVICE attribute string:
          • Split on SERVICE_ITEM_SEPARATOR (e.g. ";") into key‑value tokens.
          • For each token, split on NAME_VALUE_SEPARATOR (e.g. "=") to get name and value.
          • If the name is "serviceEndpoint", prepend the provided rootUrl to the path.
          • Assemble these into a JSON object string: {"id":"…","type":"…","serviceEndpoint":"…"}.
        2. Join all service‑object strings into a JSON array.
      4. Assemble final document Wrap contexts, id, and the service array into the top‑level JSON object.
      Parameters:
      role - the Keycloak RoleModel containing the DID attributes
      rootUrl - base URL to prefix any relative serviceEndpoint paths
      Returns:
      a JSON string representing the complete DID service document

    • close
